thread.title: Labour fury at Diane Abbott's missing vote on Brexit
thread.title_full: Labour fury at Diane Abbott's missing vote on Brexit

title: Labour fury at Diane Abbott's missing vote on Brexit
text: comments Diane Abbott faced questions from furious Labour colleagues today after she missed the historic vote on starting Brexit talks. The shadow home secretary was in Westminster all day but failed to take part in a series of crucial votes from 7pm last night. Labour MPs were under orders from Jeremy Corbyn to back the Bill and four shadow ministers - including three from the shadow cabinet - quit posts to oppose the law. Sources close to Ms Abbott said she was taken ill at around 5pm and had to head home to Hackney after speaking in Westminster Hall. Her diary is said to have been cleared for the rest of the week. Diane Abbott, file picture with Jeremy Corbyn, faced questions from furious Labour colleagues today after she missed the historic vote on starting Brexit talks Ms Abbott was in Parliament for a Westminster Hall debate, pictured, just hours before missing the historic votes in the Commons Just 15 Labour MPs failed to make it into the Commons division lobbies for the three votes, including the historic vote in principle on changing the law to allow Theresa May to start Brexit. One furious Labour backbencher pointed out to MailOnline that Shadow communities Secretary Grahame Morris and Ronnie Campbell had both voted despite recently undergoing cancer treatment. 'No-one believes she was ill. People who are seriously ill came down and voted and she went AWOL. RELATED ARTICLES
